title: Correlation
text: attempt link similar features basis correlation. TangledFeatures automatically detects type correlation needed two features. currently generate correlations numeric, unordered categorical variables ordered categorical variables can set correlation type based upon data set within package. can also generate correlation heat map entire data set well interconnected network graph

title: Correlation
text: Numeric--Numeric Correlation: Set cor1 metric. Currently defaults Pearson correlation Numeric--Factor(Unordered): Set cor2 metric. Currently defaults PointBiserial correlation Numeric--Factor(Ordered): Set cor3 metric. Currently defaults Kendall correlation Factor(Unordered)--Factor(Ordered) Set cor3 metric. Currently defaults chi Squared test Factor(Unordered)--Factor(Unordered) Set cor3 metric. Currently defaults Cramer’s V Factor(Ordered)--Factor(Ordered) Set cor3 metric. Currently defaults Polychoric correlation

title: Correlation
text: Set plot = TRUE initial function can generate heat map final TangledFeatures object can generate interconnected graph well
code: plot_obj <- TangledFeatures(Data)$Correlation_heatmap plot(plot_obj) plot_obj <- TangledFeatures(Data)$Graph_plot plot(plot_obj)

title: Example_Walkthrough
text: able identify variable class variable assign ’s appropriate correlation relationship variables. Read Correlation section. Let’s call main package function. function returns visualizations metrics correlation well interesting outputs.  visualization purposes, working top 20 variables. can take various relationships visualize single graph. TangledFeatures also returns variables well correlation metric used . graph can broadly see two clusters interrelated variables, basement related variables garage related variables. Additionally smaller clusters.  TangledFeatures uses graph theory algorithms define clusters interrelated variables. network plot can see two clusters observed heatmap, well clusters. Let’s see correlation sales price variables. plotting significant correlations 0.4 -0.4 space.  Although simple correlation course indicative variable’s behavior linear model, good starting place see relationships. garage basement variables positive negative relationships dependent variable. Let’s observe positive relationship Garage Area Sale price.
code: Results <- TangledFeatures::TangledFeatures(Data = TangledFeatures::Housing_Prices_dataset[,-1], Y_var = 'SalePrice', Focus_variables = list(), corr_cutoff = 0.85, RF_coverage = 0.95,  plot = TRUE, fast_calculation = FALSE, cor1 = 'pearson', cor2 = 'polychoric', cor3 = 'spearman') Heatmap_plot <- Results$Correlation_heatmap plot(Heatmap_plot) Igraph_plot <- Results$Graph_plot plot(Igraph_plot) cor_df <- as.data.frame(sort(cor(Data$Cleaned_Data)[,37])) cor_df$Correlation <- cor_df[,1]  cor_df <- cor_df[c(-1)] cor_df$Variable <- rownames(cor_df)  rownames(cor_df) <- NULL   cor_df_subset <- cor_df[abs(cor_df$Correlation) > 0.4,] cor_df_subset <- cor_df_subset[order(-cor_df_subset$Correlation), ] rownames(cor_df_subset) <- NULL cor_df_subset$Variable <- as.factor(cor_df_subset$Variable)  p <- ggplot(data = cor_df_subset, aes(x = Correlation, y = Variable)) +             geom_bar(stat="identity") +             scale_y_discrete(limits = cor_df_subset$Variable)  plot(p)

title: Example_Walkthrough
text: Let us input given features linear model observe behavior features selected seem indicate significance importantly agree findings correlation analysis.
code: TangledFeatures_variables <- Results$Final_Variables formula_TangledFeatures <- as.formula(paste(paste("sale_price", '~'), paste(TangledFeatures_variables, collapse = "+"))) lm_TangledFeatures <- lm(formula_TangledFeatures, data = Data$Cleaned_Data)  summary(lm_TangledFeatures) #>  #> Call: #> lm(formula = formula_TangledFeatures, data = Data$Cleaned_Data) #>  #> Residuals: #>     Min      1Q  Median      3Q     Max  #> -509617  -16390    -986   13888  266668  #>  #> Coefficients: #>                  Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)     #> (Intercept)    -1.056e+06  1.147e+05  -9.206  < 2e-16 *** #> overall_qual    1.674e+04  1.147e+03  14.595  < 2e-16 *** #> gr_liv_area     5.093e+01  2.430e+00  20.960  < 2e-16 *** #> year_built      2.438e+02  4.501e+01   5.417 7.10e-08 *** #> total_bsmt_sf   2.282e+01  2.764e+00   8.258 3.30e-16 *** #> garage_area     3.959e+01  5.874e+00   6.738 2.30e-11 *** #> year_remod_add  2.672e+02  6.061e+01   4.408 1.12e-05 *** #> bsmt_qual_ex    4.948e+04  4.014e+03  12.326  < 2e-16 *** #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 #>  #> Residual standard error: 36350 on 1452 degrees of freedom #> Multiple R-squared:  0.7917, Adjusted R-squared:  0.7906  #> F-statistic: 788.2 on 7 and 1452 DF,  p-value: < 2.2e-16

title: Example_Walkthrough
text: take look coefficient behavior across three models variables, can see largely one major exception.  can see coefficients well confidence intervals linear model. Lasso Random Forest make garage_area variable negative, highly correlated variables. TangledFeatures takes variable interrelationships account generates correct variable effect. confidence interval model TangledFeatures tighter well.
code: jtools::plot_summs(lm_TangledFeatures, lm_rfe, lm_lasso , coefs =                     names(lm_TangledFeatures$coef)[! names(lm_TangledFeatures$coef) %in% c(("(Intercept)"),                        "overall_qual", "bsmt_qual_ex")],                    model.names = c("TangledFeatures", "Random Forest RFE", "Lasso"))

title: Feature Selection in Highly Correlated Spaces
text: Note: website updated coming days. Please drop email allensunny1242@gmail.com issues. TangledFeatures feature selection method extracts needed variables highly interrelated spaces. alter nature variables hence alternative traditional dimensionality reduction techniques. Features extracted meant input easily explainable models linear/logistic regressions shallow decision trees. TangledFeatures attempts provide highly accurate interpretable models opposed current black box solutions.

title: Feature Selection in Highly Correlated Spaces
text: TangledFeatures Package now available CRAN can install development version TangledFeatures like : downloaded package, can load using:

title: Feature Selection in Highly Correlated Spaces
code: Result = TangledFeatures(Data, Y_var, Focus_variables = list(), corr_cutoff = 0.7, RF_coverage = 0.95, num_features = 5,  plot = FALSE, fast_calculation = FALSE, cor1 = 'pearson', cor2 = 'PointBiserial', cor3 = 'cramersV')

title: Feature Selection in Highly Correlated Spaces
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: library(TangledFeatures) ## basic example code  Result = TangledFeatures(Data, Y_var, Focus_variables = list(), corr_cutoff = 0.7, RF_coverage = 0.95, num_features = 5,  plot = FALSE, fast_calculation = FALSE, cor1 = 'pearson', cor2 = 'PointBiserial', cor3 = 'cramersV')  Variables <- Result$Groups

title: The main TangledFeatures function — TangledFeatures
code: TangledFeatures(   Data,   Y_var,   Focus_variables = list(),   corr_cutoff = 0.85,   RF_coverage = 0.95,   plot = FALSE,   fast_calculation = FALSE,   cor1 = "pearson",   cor2 = "polychoric",   cor3 = "spearman" )

title: The main TangledFeatures function — TangledFeatures
text: Data imported Data Frame Y_var dependent variable Focus_variables list variables wish give certain bias correlation matrix corr_cutoff correlation cutoff variable. Defaults 0.8 RF_coverage Random Forest coverage explainable. Defaults 95 percent plot Return plotting done. Binary True False fast_calculation Returns variable list without many Random Forest iterations simply picking variable correlated group cor1 correlation metric two continuous features. Defaults pearson correlation cor2 correlation metric one categorical feature one continuous feature. Defaults bi serial correlation correlation cor3 correlation metric two categorical features. Defaults Cramer's V.

title: The main TangledFeatures function — TangledFeatures
text: Returns list variables ready future modelling, along metrics

title: The main TangledFeatures function — TangledFeatures
